Posts.Content: May 27, 2010 08:08PM gemo wrote: Good luck with your scans.  I have scans coming up in June to see if Aromasin is working for me after progression after 2 1/2 yrs on Arimidex.  Sending you warm thoughts and gentle hugs.

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2010 06:11PM gemo wrote: But the pink ribbon is so "pretty".  Ignoring metastatic disease keeps that myth going and information harder to find as a result.  It's also much more marketable - how nice that companies are able to sell pink things at others expense.
Posts.Title: Pulling the Pink Band Aid Off Breast Cancer Terry3N Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2010 06:46PM gemo wrote: I felt like I had been hit by a bus.  Every joint hurt from my arms to my big toe.  Heat helped but mine lasted for 3-4 days iwth a little left over after that.

Posts.Content: May 5, 2010 06:10PM gemo wrote: Sorry to hear you have "graduated" to stage IV.  I've been stg IV since May 07.  I find that my sense of humor is a saving grace.  Good luck with your treatment.
Posts.Title: Yup, Another One susan_02143 Kellke

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 05:06PM gemo wrote: I read the obits as well.  I sometimes see trends of women close to my age who "fought a hard battle".  I figure I should stop reading them but don't.  It can get depressing, so I just decide that I'm going to out survive the rest.  As long as I can keep my body convinced, it should work.
Posts.Title: It's hard to stay positive lukejessesmom Padiddle

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 08:59PM gemo wrote: I agree with those above.  I don't believe we should have to live in pain because of fear of addiction.  We need to keep on  movin' and pain control will often be the key.   Re: constipation Miralax daily in juice is the ticket for me.
Posts.Title: Do you ever feel you will get addicted to pain meds? Reneepals barbe1958

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2010 09:04PM gemo wrote: The first couple were very ouchy for me.  Severe headache and body pain.  They get much better.  I have been getting treatment for 3 years.  I just get a little (more) achy and tired but it only lasts for the evening that I get the treatment.  Do stick with lots of water.
Posts.Title: 1st Zometa infusion-----ARGGGGGH Chickadee cmhartley

Posts.Content: May 26, 2017 07:40PM gemo wrote: I have worked full time since diagnosed Stage IV 10 years ago.  I am now working solely from home and don't think I could do it otherwise.  It is a great relief financially but also helps to keep me distracted.

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2010 04:58PM gemo wrote: 1st diagnosed at 36.  Mets at age 48.
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2010 08:28PM gemo wrote: Ead - I have been on Zometa since May of 07 (every month x 2yrs, then every 3 months) and Arimidex since August of 07.  I have been followed regularly by my dentist due to the possiblility of osteonecrosis.  I have extensive bone mets and have had increased pain for the past few weeks.  At the same time, I too started having jaw pain.  First on the left side, and now on both sides.  I have historically clenched by jaw in my sleep but it has caused more tooth pain then jaw.  I see my onc tomorrow and will pass on any info that might help.
Posts.Title: Has anyone had jaw pain? ead gemo

Posts.Content: May 22, 2010 08:16PM gemo wrote: jleigh - I take Effexor.  Anti-depressants have been found to help with pain (especially in the back actually).  It has helps  in a number of  ways by helping curb the pain which gets exhausting and lifting depression.   It also helps with hot flashes(also draining).  I also take a sleeper.  Fatigue doesn't help any of us cope with this situation.  I believe in quality of life so have no issues with taking meds. Good luck Gigi
Posts.Title: Sadness jleigh jleigh

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2010 06:24PM gemo wrote: sending prayers and hugs Gigi

Posts.Content: gemo wrote: I have a new script for Provigil for daily fatigue.  No matter how long or well I sleep, I have difficulty getting up and staying awake in the morning.  Not so healthy when you drive 2-6 hours a day.  I would appreciate hearing anyones experience with Provigil. Dx 5/2007, IDC, Stage IV, 2/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Provigil anyone? gemo gemo

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2010 05:46PM gemo wrote: I take Lunesta but work out of town a lot so even that doesn't do it completely.  I use aroma therapy also.  Lavendar and Body Works "Deep Sleep".  Before that I had heard counting backward by 3's was effective.  It keeps you from about everything and is so boring it puts you to sleep.  Worked the first time, but then I started worrying about whether or not I missed number, then I would have to start again.
Posts.Title: TIRED! TIRED! FLIPPING NEEDHELP JustJudi cmhartley

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2010 08:53PM gemo wrote: I'm taking 200 mg every day.  I am on Zometa and AIs and was fighting sleep all day.  Took the first one this morning without any ill effect.  I didn't get sleepy and expecting jitters or something but felt pretty good.  Now I will have to see if I can sleep.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Provigil anyone? gemo gemo

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 08:02PM gemo wrote: I was diagnosed with extensive bone mets and HAD one lesion on my lung in May '07.  I have been on Arimidex and Zometa (monthly x2yrs; every 3 months since).  The lung lesion is gone and many of the bone mets faded.  I just figure the longer I go the more time they have to develop something else.  Hope treatment goes well for you!
